channel.title: Summit on Roadsign Pictures

item.description: Entering Daggett County on US-191 North. Summit at Elevation 8428 Feet. Daggett County is the least populated county in Utah

item.description: Satus Pass - Elevation 3107 Feet on US-97 south. Satus Pass is a summit in the Simcoe Mountains.

item.description: Summit Elevation 7180 Feet on I-70 west. This is the summit of the Pavant Range.

item.description: Daniels Summit - Elevation 8020 Feet on US-40 west.

item.title: CO-82 East - Independence Pass
item.description: Independence Pass on CO-82 east. Independence Pass is 12,095 Feet and on the Continental Divide. Independence Pass is one of the highest mountain passes in Colorado on the state highway system. The only higher pass on the state highway system is US-34 in Rocky Mountain National Park. Independence Pass divides the Arkansas River watershed which flows into the Gulf of Mexico; and the Roaring Fork River which flows into the Colorado River and the Gulf of California.

item.title: US-50 East - Spooner Summit
item.description: Spooner Summit on US-50 east - Elevation 7146 Feet. Spooner Summit is a pass through the Carson Range.

item.title: US-50 East - Echo Summit
item.description: US-50 each at Echo Summit -Elevation 7382 Feet. This is the summit of the Sierra Nevada on US-50 and the divide between the American River drainage and Lake Tahoe, which drains to the Truckee River.

item.title: US-50 West - Echo Summit
item.description: US-50 west at Echo Summit -Elevation 7382 Feet. This is the summit of the Sierra Nevada on US-50 and the divide between the American River drainage and Lake Tahoe, which drains to the Truckee River.

item.title: NV-208 West - Jack Wright Pass
item.description: Jack Wright Pass - Elevation 5484 Feet.

item.title: US-30 West - Fish Creek Summit
item.description: US-30 west at Fish Creek Summit.

item.title: MT-87 South - Raynolds Pass
item.description: MT-87 at Raynolds Pass - Leaving Montana. The Idaho welcome sign is in the background. An early season snow storm had just passed through the area, leaving wet snow on all of the signs.

item.title: ID-29 West - Bannock Pass - Idaho State Line
item.description: Idaho State Line on ID-29 west at Bannock Pass - Elevation 7672 Feet. Bannock Pass is on the Continental Divide located on the Idaho-Montana border.

item.title: OR-242 East - McKenzie Pass
item.description: OR-242 East - McKenzie Pass - Elevation 5325 Feet. McKenzie Pass is closed during the winter months, and is also closed year round to long vehicles. The top of the pass is a lava field, with great views of the area volcanos.

item.title: I-5 South - Canyon Creek Summit
item.description: I-5 south at Canyon Creek Summit - Elevation 2020 Feet. Canyon Creek Summit is the highest of the series of passes in the Klamath Mountains between Canyonville and Grants Pass along I-5.

item.title: CA-89 South - Luther Pass
item.description: Luther Pass - Elevation 7740 Feet. Luther Pass is on the divide between the Lake Tahoe Basin (to the north) and the Carson River.

item.title: CA-89 South - Summit Information
item.description: Summit closure information on CA-89 south. Information for Ebbetts Pass (via CA-4), Monitor Pass (via CA-89) and Carson Pass (via CA-88). This photograph was taken in mid-June, and all of the passes are open. Carson Pass on CA-88 is the only pass that is typically opened year round.

item.title: US-50 East - Echo Summit
item.description: US-50 each at Echo Summit -Elevation 7382 Feet. This is the summit of the Sierra Nevada on US-50 and the divide between the American River drainage and Lake Tahoe, which drains to the Truckee River.

item.title: I-15 South - Elk Park Pass
item.description: I-15 south at Elk Park Pass (Continental Divide). Elevation 6368 Feet. This is also the county boundary between Silver Bow and Jefferson County.

item.title: I-90 East - Bozeman Pass
item.description: I-90 east at Bozeman Pass. Bozeman Pass is part of the Absaroka Mountain Range. These type of signs are common across Montana, giving name to the many mountain ranges in the state.

item.title: US-50 West - Little Antelope Summit
item.description: US-50 west at Little Antelope Summit - Elevation 7,438 Feet. Little Antelope Summit is in the Pine Range.

item.title: US-50 West - Robinson Summit
item.description: US-50 west at Robinson Pass - Elevation 7,607 Feet. Robinson Pass is in the Egan Range.

item.title: US-93 North - Lake Valley Summit
item.description: Lake Valley Summit - Elevation 6,140 Feet on US-93 north. Wheeler Peak is the mountain in the background. Wheeler Peak is the second highest mountain in Nevada and is located in Great Basin National Park.

item.title: US-95 North - Paradise Summit
item.description: Paradise Summit - Elevation 4907 Feet on US-95 North.

item.title: NV-359 North - Anchorite Pass
item.description: Anchorite Pass - Elevation 7,626 Feet on NV-359 North.

item.title: I-80 West - Elevation 8640
item.description: I-80 west - Elevation 8640. This is the highest point on all of I-80. The summit lies between Cheyenne and Laramie in the Sherman Mountains.

item.title: UT-24 West - Summit
item.description: Summit 8,385 Feet on UT-24 west. This is the summit of the Awapa Plateau.

item.title: NV-431 East - Mount Rose Summit
item.description: NV-431 East at Mount Rose Summit - Elevation 8900 Feet. Mount Rose Summit is one of the few Sierra Nevada passes in Nevada, and is the highest pass open year round in the Sierra Nevada.

item.title: CA-267 South - Brockway Summit
item.description: CA-267 South - Brockway Summit (Elevation 7179 Feet). Brockway Summit divides the Truckee area from the Tahoe Basin. CA-267 south quickly descends into Lake Tahoe.

item.title: OR-140 East - Summit - Doherty Rim
item.description: Doherty Rim Summit, Elevation 6,240 Feet on OR-140 east in rural Lake County.

item.title: US-93 North - Lake Valley Summit
item.description: Lake Valley Summit - Elevation 6,140 Feet on US-93 north. Wheeler Peak is the snow covered mountain in the background.

item.title: US-30 West - Georgetown Summit
item.description: US-30 west at Gorgetown Summit - Elevation 6,283 Feet. Idaho Transportation Maintenance Yard in the background.

item.title: I-40 West - Mountain Springs Summit
item.description: I-40 west at Mountain Springs Summit - Elevation 2770 Feet.

item.description: I-80 east at Silverzone Pass - Elevation 5,940 Feet.

item.description: WA-20 east at Loup Loup Pass - Elevation 4,020 Feet.

item.description: I-15 north at Malad Summit - Elevation 5,574 Feet.

item.title: I-80 West - Continental Divide (East)
item.description: I-80 west at the eastern Continental Divide, 7000 Feet. I-80 west crosses the Great Divide Basin.

item.title: US-40 - Berthoud Pass
item.description: US-40 at Berthoud Pass. Continental Divide and Grand-Clear Creek County Line.

item.description: US-26 at Keyes Creek Summit, Elevation 4,569 Feet.
